verses.verse: Yet now hear<WH8085>, O Jacob<WH3290> my servant<WH5650>; and Israel<WH3478>, whom I have chosen<WH977>:

They that make<WH3335> a engraved image<WH6459> are all of them vanity<WH8414>; and their delectable things<WH2530> shall not profit<WH3276>; and they are their own witnesses<WH5707>; they see<WH7200> not<WH3045>, nor know; that they may be ashamed<WH954>.

Behold<WH2270>, all his fellows shall be ashamed<WH954>: and the workmen<WH2796>, they are of men<WH120>: let them all be gathered together<WH6908>, let them stand up<WH5975>; yet they shall fear<WH6342>, and they shall be ashamed<WH954> together<WH3162>.

The blacksmith<WH1270> with the tongs<WH4621> both works<WH6466> in the coals<WH6352>, and fashions<WH3335> it with hammers<WH4717>, and works<WH6466> it with the strength<WH3581> of his arms<WH2220>: Yes<WH7457>, he is hungry, and his strength<WH3581> fails<WH369>: he drinks<WH8354> no water<WH4325>, and is faint<WH3286>.

He cuts him down<WH3772> cedars<WH730>, and takes<WH3947> the cypress<WH8645> and the oak<WH437>, which he strengthens<WH553> for himself among the trees<WH6086> of the forest<WH3293>: he plants<WH5193> a ash<WH766>, and the rain<WH1653> does nourish it<WH1431>.

Then shall it be for a man<WH120> to burn<WH1197>: for he will take<WH3947> there<WH2552>, and warm himself<WH5400>; Yes, he kindles it<WH644>, and bakes bread<WH3899>; Yes<WH6466>, he makes a god<WH410>, and worships<WH7812> it<WH6213>; he makes it a engraved image<WH6459>, and falls down to it<WH5456>.

And with the residue<WH7611> he makes<WH6213> a god<WH410>, even his engraved image<WH6459>: he falls down<WH5456> unto it<WH7812>, and worships it<WH6419>, and prays unto it<WH559>, and says, Deliver<WH5337> me<WH410>; for you are my god.
They have not known<WH3045> nor understood<WH995>: for he has shut<WH2902> their eyes<WH5869>, that they cannot see<WH7200>; and their hearts<WH3826>, that they cannot understand<WH7919>.

And none considers<WH7725> in his heart<WH3820>, neither is there knowledge<WH1847> nor understanding<WH8394> to say<WH559>, I have burned<WH8313> part<WH2677> of it in<WH1119> the fire<WH784>; Yes<WH644>, also I have baked bread<WH3899> upon the coals<WH1513> there<WH6740>; I have roasted flesh<WH1320>, and eaten<WH398> it<WH6213>: and shall I make the residue<WH3499> there an abomination<WH8441>? shall I fall down<WH5456> to the stock<WH944> of a tree<WH6086>?

Remember<WH2142> these<WH3290>, O Jacob and Israel<WH3478>; for you are my servant<WH5650>: I have formed<WH3335> you<WH5650>; you are my servant: O Israel<WH3478>, you shall not be forgotten of me<WH5382>.
I have blotted out<WH4229>, as a thick cloud<WH5645>, your transgressions<WH6588>, and<WH6051>, as a cloud, your sins<WH2403>: return<WH7725> unto me<WH1350>; for I have redeemed you.

Sing<WH7442>, O you heavens<WH8064>; for the Lord<WH3068> has done<WH6213> it<WH7321>: shout, you lower parts<WH8482> of the earth<WH776>: break forth<WH6476> into singing<WH7440>, you mountains<WH2022>, O forest<WH3293>, and every tree<WH6086> in it<WH3068>: for the Lord has redeemed<WH1350> Jacob<WH3290>, and glorified<WH6286> himself in Israel<WH3478>.

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, your redeemer<WH1350>, and he that formed<WH3335> you from the womb<WH990>, I am the Lord<WH3068> that makes<WH6213> all things<WH5186>; that stretches forth the heavens<WH8064> alone<WH7554>; that spreads abroad the earth by myself<WH776>;
